answerText: quasars [accept "quasi-stellar radio source"][10] Quasars are thought to be one of these structures, which are not present in starburst galaxies. These objects are present in both Type 1 and Type 2 Seyfert galaxies and are most likely supermassive black holes.
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | Finals 2 | 5 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: They are the most optically active phenomena in the universe and they emit x-ray and radio jets. For 10 points each: [10] Name these objects which produce highly redshifted spectra and are often theorized to be supermassive black holes.
